page.title: 01Scottish Border Hill Country
page.content: This is the hilly land of the Border Country, sharply broken hills with little burns running in all directions before feeding into the White Esk which runs South. It rises three feet from a few days of rain and falls just as quickly. The fishing is good, but better a valley or two further south where the water is more constant and the fish bigger. Holiday makers are welcomed, there are a few holiday cottages to rent but it is not popular enough to influence the economy. The hills are dominated by the conifers of the Forestry Commission, but the bottom land where the road and the scattered houses are is rich cultivated pasture and despite the ubiquitous pines the countryside is varied, colourful, ever changing and strikingly beautiful.
